CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 4, 1943, pg. 14, reads: "Elkdom on Parade! ... Thousands See Colorful Event ... Nation Represented. Tuesday afternoon, the Elks held their famous annual convention parade.  Up and down the hills of Pittsburgh marched the members of the Antlered Herd to the cheers and applause of thousands of spectators.  While not as long as parades in other years, it was still colorful and entertaining... 12. Mounted policemen who led the colorful parade... - Courier Photos by Harris, Sockwell and Olmstead."
TitMainTitle: Annual Elks parade, with mounted police officers, near Northside Elks Lodge No. 124, Wylie Avenue, Hill District
